original: Andolf, Sven, lektor, Göteborg, f. 3/5/00 i Lindesberg av framl. järnvi-trädgim. J. A. Peterson o. Atina Andersson. — Studiex. v. norra latin i .Sthlm 21, baccalauréat i Grenoble 23, fil. mag. v. Upps. univ. 27, fil. lic. 33, fil. dr 42. Studires. t. Tyskl. o. Schweiz 21, två års stud. v. franska lärov. 21-23, Heidelberg 25, Frankr. 30, Spanien 30, Frankr. (Paris, Caen) 31-32, (Tours) 39. Vik. ämneslär. i Kopparberg 29, è. lär. i Linköp. 29, Sigtu-nask. 32-37, e. adj. v. Upps. h. a. 1. 38, timlär. v. Fjellstedtska sk. i Upps. 40-41, lektor i Halmstad 42-47, lektor i tyska o. franska v. Vasa h. a. 1. i Gbg sed. 47. Ordf. i Anglo-Sw^edish Society i Halmistad 44-47, ’seikr. i Hailmsitads Riotarykl. 44-47, ordf. i Polygtott-kl. 43-47. Skr. i Petite Grammaire suédoise (33), Floovant, chanson de geste du Xllie siècle (gradiavh. 41), Une version bourguignonne du Dit de rUnicorne et du Serpent (43) samt tidsknart. Hobby i fotografering.
translated: Andolf, Sven, lecturer, Gothenburg, born on May 3, 1900 in Lindesberg to distinguished iron railroad gardener J.A. Peterson and Atina Andersson. He received his studentexamen (bachelor's degree) from Norra Latin in Stockholm in 1921, baccalauréat from Grenoble in 1923, fil. mag from Uppsala University in 1927, fil. lic. in 1933, and fil. dr. in 1942. He studied in Germany and Switzerland in 1921, spent two years studying in French schools from 1921 to 1923, and studied in Heidelberg in 1925, France in 1930 and Spain in 1930. He also studied in France (Paris, Caen) from 1931 to 1932, and in Tours in 1939. He served as a substitute teacher in Kopparberg in 1929, a full-time teacher in Linköping in 1929, Sigtuna School from 1932 to 1937, assistant teacher in Uppsala University in 1938, hourly teacher at Fjellstedtska School in Uppsala from 1940 to 1941, lecturer in Halmstad from 1942 to 1947, and lecturer in German and French at Vasa High School in Gothenburg since 1947. He was the chairman of the Anglo-Swedish Society in Halmstad from 1944 to 1947, the secretary of Halmstad's Rotary Club from 1944 to 1947 and the chairman of the Polyglott Club from 1943 to 1947. He authored Petite Grammaire suédoise (33), Floovant, chanson de geste du Xllie siècle (gradiavh. 41), Une version bourguignonne du Dit de rUnicorne et du Serpent (43), and other timely articles. His hobby is photography.
